system_architecture.semantic_kernel: STATE-C alone is sufficient - system is fundamentally monostate

control_logic.convergence_mechanism: System decreases stability level through iterative processing until STATE-C optimum reached
control_logic.forbidden_transition_purpose: A↔B is forbidden because these states represent incompatible processing modes; transformation must pass through STATE-C (processing hub) to convert between them

FUNCTIONAL_RECONSTRUCTION.functional_interpretation: The Voynich state machine optimizes STABILITY by processing through 1 essential states along a 1D STABILITY_GRADIENT. STATE-C serves as PROCESSING_HUB. The forbidden A↔B transition enforces System decreases stability level through iterative processing. The system is designed for repeatable, convergent, error-tolerant transformation processing.

KEY_INSIGHTS: Repetitions are NOT essential for convergence - system is resilient to compression
Extra repetitions have no effect - system tolerates redundancy
STATE-C is mandatory waypoint between forbidden states - central processing hub
Initiator state is conventional, not essential - system is robust to entry point

AXIS_CHARACTERIZATION.name: STABILITY_GRADIENT
AXIS_CHARACTERIZATION.interpretation: The system performs oscillatory fixation along the STABILITY_GRADIENT
